alert.note: Alert for Eastern Payette National Forest; Western Payette National Forest (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 22 at 7:43AM MDT until August 22 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS THE PAYETTE NATIONAL FOREST MONDAY AFTERNOON... .An upper level trough will move through eastern Oregon and central Idaho today. This will result in scattered thunderstorms across the Payette National Forest this afternoon with abundant lightning possible. Dry lower levels of the atmosphere will not allow much rain to reach the surface but will allow for very gusty outflow winds in the vicinity of these storms. Greatest thunderstorm coverage is expected to be north and east of the McCall area. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR LIGHTNING FOR WESTERN PAYETTE NATIONAL FOREST AND EASTERN PAYETTE NATIONAL FOREST...WHICH ARE FIRE WEATHER ZONES 401 AND 402... The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 6 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * DRY LIGHTING * OUTFLOW WINDS...40-50 mph.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Payette National Forest; Western Payette National Forest
